items.title: A conversation on powering prosperity in Atlantic Canada
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content: <article>Join Minister Fraser and Don Mills for a conversation on collaboration, innovation, and reshaping our future.</article>

items.title: Rodd Charlottetown - Charlottetown, PEI
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>The Rodd family has been a driving force in Atlantic Canada‚Äôs tourism industry for 90 years, and their stunning renovation of Rodd  Charlottetown this year shows they have no plans of slowing down.

Transcript
The Rodd Charlottetown Hotel has been welcoming guests since 1931.
The oldest heritage hotel in Prince Edward Island, the property combines old world charm with modern amenities. 
With 115 rooms, a restaurant and Victorian-style conference rooms, the full-service hotel is a cornerstone of the downtown core.
It's one of four remaining hotels built across the country by Canadian National Railway.
In 2024, the historic property began an extensive $10 million renovation.
The major project included restoration of the building‚Äôs brick exterior, upgrades to the guest rooms and improvements to energy efficiency.
The goal is to preserve the historical integrity of the building while preparing the property for another 100 years.
ACOA is proud to support the Rodd Charlottetown Hotel as they honour the past and seize today‚Äôs opportunities.</article>

items.title: The Smart Energy Company - Upper Golden Grove, New Brunswick
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content: <article>The Smart Energy Company is helping farmers cut costs & embrace sustainability. With ACOA‚Äôs support, this Atlantic Canadian small biz is scaling clean energy across Canada.</article>

items.title: Emmerson Packaging ‚Äì Amherst, Nova Scotia
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Emmerson Packaging is a 3rd-generation family-owned manufacturer and supplier of premium flexible packaging. The company is investing to reduce its carbon footprint and save money, estimating that modern equipment purchased with ACOA support will save $500,000 a year.

Trancript
Emmerson Packaging estimates modern equipment purchased with ACOA support will save $500,000 a year.

The 3rd-generation family business has 450 employees and 2 facilities in Amherst, Nova Scotia and Belleville, Ontario.

It manufactures and supplies premium flexible packaging to industries across North America.

As a certified Sustainable Green Printer, Emmerson Packaging makes sustainability a priority. 

Its new laminator will decrease energy use by 20%, decrease waste, and create 12 new jobs.

The company is investing to reduce its carbon footprint and 
save money.</article>

items.title: The Defence Advantage: Built in Atlantic Canada
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Atlantic Canada is driving Canada‚Äôs defence industry ‚Äî with innovation, talent, and technology that keep our country secure.
From shipbuilding to maintenance and repairs, simulation and training, ground vehicle solutions, cyber resilience, and advanced manufacturing, this region is shaping the future of defence and security.
See how Atlantic Canada is:
‚Ä¢ Building world-class solutions in the land, naval and aerospace domains
‚Ä¢ Creating highly skilled jobs and long-term growth
‚Ä¢ Strengthening Canada‚Äôs security at home and abroad
#AtlanticCanada #DefenceIndustry #Innovation #AerospaceandDefence #Security #shipbuildingstocks 

Transcription:
Canada‚Äôs defence future is being built right here in Atlantic Canada.
At COVE, where companies fast-track, test, and validate new technology.
At NATO‚Äôs Defence Innovation Accelerator for the North Atlantic - known as DIANA ‚Äì where innovators access funding, mentorship, and NATO‚Äôs global innovation network.
At PAL Aerospace and IMP Aerospace & Defence - where skilled workers keep our skies secure, coasts monitored, and military aircraft ready-to-fly.
At Irving Shipbuilding ‚Äì where Canada‚Äôs next-generation naval and coast guard vessels are being built.
And at Atlantic Canada Aerospace & Defence Association member companies across the region, serving both commercial and defence markets globally.
Atlantic Canada goes above and beyond to support national defence efforts.
And with more defence spending coming, this region is ready to lead.
Atlantic Canada‚Äôs defence industry is a national strength.
We have the people and the know-how to lead the way, and build a safer world.</article>

items.title: Bridgewater Ready Mix, Bridgewater, Nova Scotia
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Bridgewater Ready Mix in NS is making concrete more eco-friendly. With support from ACOA, it‚Äôs producing greener concrete and cutting emissions. The company plans to switch to clean energy and reduce CO‚ÇÇ by 40% by 2030. 

Transcript
Bridgewater Ready Mix in Bridgewater, Nova Scotia takes concrete performance and global warming seriously.
The company is committed to the industry‚Äôs plan for net-zero concrete by 2050. 
With help from ACOA, Bridgewater Ready Mix is increasing green concrete production.
Its greening initiatives include many factors.
The company is the first in the province to publish Type III Environmental Product Declarations.
This provides transparent, objective, and third-party verified data about the environmental performance of its products.
The company is an early adopter of limestone cement, which reduces emissions by up to 10% compared to regular cement.
And it is making plans to switch to cleaner energy resources to power the plant, mix and transport cement.
Greener products, with performance customers count on.
Bridgewater Ready Mix aims to reach a 40% CO2 reduction by 2030 on the path to net-zero.</article>

items.title: Ability NB and the Municipality of Grand Lake - New Brunswick
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Accessibility is more than a checklist ‚Äî it‚Äôs a mindset.  
   
Thanks to a partnership between Ability New Brunswick and the Municipality of Grand Lake, supported by ACOA, rural communities are embracing inclusive design and transforming public spaces.  
   
This story shows how thoughtful collaboration can lead to lasting impact ‚Äî and a more accessible future for everyone.

Executive Director of Ability NB, Haley Flaro, says:
‚ÄúThis is our first collaboration with ACOA, and it‚Äôs a shining example of what‚Äôs possible when federal partners work hand-in-hand with communities.‚Äù

Transcript:
Alyson:

It all started we were planning to make some renovations to the washroom facilities at the Chipman Heritage Centre.

We knew kinda through residents that they were not easily accessible in a wheelchair or mobility aid.

I ended up speaking with Ability New Brunswick. They let us know that they actually had a free accessibility review that they could do of our buildings.

We learned so much about tactical signage, making sure that our spaces are cane friendly.

It was so much more than just ensuring that people can enter the building.

And from there, we've really started a wonderful collaboration with them that we know will continue past just these buildings.

We have more throughout the municipality, and we are also just really doing our best to promote it to other private businesses in the community.


Haley Flaro:

I just love this collaboration because it‚Äôs a perfect example of community working with community.

And the large tourism that happens, especially in the Grand Lake area drawing more people in to the communities to be able to access important museums, infrastructure, you know, recreation areas.

It‚Äôs really critical., so we‚Äôre really proud of this collaboration.</article>

items.title: PEI Preserve Co. - New Glasgow, Prince Edward Island
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>The PEI Preserve Company is celebrating 40 years of good taste and tradition üéâüçìü´ê
A pioneer in the Canadian specialty food industry, the company is embracing innovation and automation so they can spread preserves and joy around the world!

Transcript - 
Built on old-fashioned values of quality and hospitality, the PEI Preserve Co. has been a pioneer in the Canadian specialty food industry since 1985.
Founded by Bruce and Shirley MacNaughton, a humble jar of handmade preserves quickly transformed into an iconic Island business.
The operation blossomed to include a river-front restaurant, gift shop, theatre caf√©, 12 acres of gardens, a butterfly house...
...and of course...
...preserves!
The preserves are sold worldwide through the company‚Äôs online giftshop, and in three locations across the Island.
In 2022, the company was purchased by Adam and Marsha Doiron, who held strong ties to the business and saw its growth potential.
The Doirons celebrated the company‚Äôs 40th ‚ÄúJam-iversary‚Äù in 2025, welcoming all who have been a part of the PEI Preserve Co. story.
It was a joyful afternoon full of flavour, music and reflection.
And special guest Chef Michael Smith opened the 5-millionth jar!
PEI Preserve Co. produces up to 100,000 jars per year, and demand continues to grow.
So, what‚Äôs next?
The Doirons have plans to expand the product line and scale up production to 500,000 jars per year by 2027.
The Government of Canada is helping businesses like PEI Preserve Co. become more productive and reach new markets.
ACOA is proud to support PEI Preserve Co. as they spread jam and joy around the world!</article>

items.title: Kings County Roadtrip, PEI
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>There‚Äôs never been a better time to hit the road and support Canadian businesses and communities. Hop in and buckle up as we take a trip through Kings County, Prince Edward Island! üöóüó∫Ô∏è

Transcription
Let‚Äôs take a trip through Kings County, PEI!
This 2-day itinerary is jam packed with authentic sights, flavours and experiences. Follow along!
Stop #1 Overnight at 45 Steps Inn in St. Peter‚Äôs Bay
Stop #2 Spend a rejuvenating morning at Mysa Nordic Spa
Stop #3 Head to the Eastern-most point of PEI to see the East Point Lighthouse
Stop #4 Learn about the history of railroad on the Island at the Elmira Railway Museum 
Stop #5 In the friendly seaside town of Souris, walk the boardwalk and enjoy fresh seafood for dinner
Stop #6 Catch a live music show at the Souris Show Hall
Stop #7 Drive south and spend the night at Rodd Brudenell River Resort in Cardigan
Stop #8 Get out on the water with Tranquility Cove Adventures
Stop #9 Pick up a sandwich and fresh local berries at Nabuurs Gardens
Stop #10 Step back in time for an afternoon at Roma National Historic Site
Stop #11 Grab a coffee and shop around Montague
Stop #12 Check out Bogside Brewing Taproom for dinner 
Stop #13 Drink in the sweeping views at Double Hill Cidery in Caledonia
Stop #14 Wrap up your trip with a one-of-a-kind stay at Nellie‚Äôs Landing in Murray Harbour!
Thanks for coming along on our road trip through Kings County, PEI!
Got wanderlust? Hit the road and support Atlantic Canadian businesses!</article>

items.title: H20: Home to Overseas Conference, 2025 ‚Äì Halifax, Nova Scotia
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Halifax is buzzing with ocean innovation! The H2O Conference is back‚ÄîCanada‚Äôs biggest ocean tech event and a global hub for marine innovation. Powered by ACOA and hosted by the Ocean Technology Council of Nova Scotia, it all wraps June 12 with Cove Demo Day!
#MarineTech #OceanInnovation

Transcript
So H2O is a platform that we use to showcase our ocean technology sector.
It‚Äôs a way for our companies to come together and showcase their technologies and innovations and work with partners from around the world.

The conference has really grown and scaled over the last ten years.

It started out really as an industry showcase specifically for companies here in Nova Scotia.

But we've really grown it into an international conference with companies from all across Canada and around the world. 

Having our international partners here is very important for the H2O conference and for our ocean technology sector as a whole.

We really have worked to turn H2O into an anchor event  that's on the calendar of international partners and members of the ocean tech sector
around the world.

So for us the ocean technology sector is predominantly driven by export.

So about 80% of our company's revenues come from export.

And with that we need to have partnerships; connections with our international markets.

And the H2O conference is a way to kind of bring those partners in 
and showcase what we do best here in Atlantic Canada.</article>

items.title: Cruise Canada and New England Symposium, 2025 - Halifax, Nova Scotia
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Cruise tourism is making a big impact in Atlantic Canada. With support from ACOA, the Atlantic Canada Cruise Association is helping local communities thrive ‚Äî one port at a time. Discover how Halifax and our region are welcoming the world while fueling inclusive economic growth across the East Coast.

Transcript
Halifax, Nova Scotia is hosting the Cruise Canada and New England Symposium, where cruise leaders explore new ideas, technology and opportunities.
Cruise ships help anchor Atlantic Canada's economy. 
With ACOA‚Äôs support, the Atlantic Canada Cruise Association champions our region as a top cruise destination, growing an industry that supports small businesses, boosts tourism, and enriches life in coastal communities.
And in return we offer more than a stop. We share a story told through heritage, food, music and East Coast spirit.
From our harbours to our hospitality, Atlantic Canada welcomes the world.</article>
